title: (Another) script font ID needed
content:
Hi, first time poster here... :)

I saw this on another board and cannot for the life of me figure out what the swirly script font is. I've gone through the Bowfin Printworks list and can't find it, so I'm turning to the experts!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829225932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/script%20font%20ID_3747.jpg)
author: lunasoleil

comments.content:
The 'I'looks a lot like the swash J from [Bickham Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829225932/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0005366#characters). The rest of the word Invited looks like [Ventura](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829225932/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=TTT0000051#flont), with an alternate connecting 'v' that shows up in the character map.

I can't see the rest of the script very well. Maybe a better view would help.

- Mike Yanega

This is a different image, but I think it's the same font...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829225932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/script%20font%20ID%202_6157.jpg)

The caps really make me think of super swashy Bickham, but the lowercase letters don't look Bickham-y at all. Maybe it is two fonts, I hadn't considered that possibility.

PS, Mr Yanega, I just wanted to say that I'm a total fangirl of your script font list. Thank you for compiling it!
I think this could be [PF Champion Script Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829225932/http:/www.parachute.gr/fonts.aspx?Sample=1&FontStyleID=&FontFamilyID=54&CharacterSetID=74). Check the PDF.

I've got an ID on this one - if anyone else is curious, it turns out that it's Copper Alt Caps Expert.

Thanks everyone for the suggestions!

The [Copper](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829225932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/classic/copper/) font says it's based on copperplate script designs. Champion Script is based on the same script that Francoise Boltana used for his font of the same name. I have to say that this "Copper" family really does look to me like a hybrid of styles, rather than a unified script style.

Trish, thanks for your comment, and for showing me a new Script font for the Guide. If you have this font, and would be willing to make samples for the Guide, I would be very grateful.

- Mike Yanega
